item.title: Outside light punched, pacing In dark portending to be on phone to take photos | 8th June 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On June 8, 2024, disturbances began around 1:30 AM with noises akin to hammering. The individual from flat number...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On June 8, 2024, disturbances began around 1:30 AM with noises akin to hammering. The individual from flat number 14 was suspected of searching for surveillance cameras, as evidenced by his behavior with his dog and previous incidents involving his associates. Despite considering contacting WDH’s out-of-hours service, the intermittent cessation of noise led us to refrain. Later, the tenant exhibited suspicious behavior outside, including feigned phone conversations and observable flashes from his phone camera, suggesting covert recording activities. At 3:20 AM, he approached the door, likely recording, and at 3:42 AM, he struck an exterior light fixture. These actions are consistent with past observations of drug-related transactions and usage, specifically cocaine, as well as withdrawal symptoms during periods without narcotics.
Reported To:
WDH and the police

Impact:
Caused stress that negatively affects Lucy’s heart condition’s.

Key Points:
Stressed, Annoying, logged as “endangerment”,

Details:
On the 8th of June, 2024, at approximately 1:30 AM, we were disturbed by loud noises resembling hammering, which interrupted our sleep and prompted us to consider contacting the out-of-hours service provided by WDH. However, the noise ceased intermittently, leading us to believe it would stop like normal, rendering a service call potentially unnecessary. Subsequently, just before 2:00 AM, we observed the individual from flat number 14 descending the stairs with considerable force, ostensibly to walk his dog. We have reasons to suspect that his true intention was to search for surveillance equipment, a behavior we have witnessed on multiple occasions. This suspicion is supported by the fact that he was observed pacing back and forth and interrupting the dog’s natural behavior, as captured in the accompanying video at the 44-second mark.

Our previous incident report includes footage of an associate of the tenant from flat number 14 attempting to open our door while the tenant himself stood by his own door, presumably to ascertain the presence of a camera monitoring that area.

Thirty minutes later, at 2:31 AM, the tenant returned outdoors without his dog and loitered for several minutes. This activity is highlighted in the video with a motion-tracing arrow. During this time, he appeared to engage in a phone conversation, but the intermittent flashes from his phone camera, particularly when he moved through shadowed areas, suggest otherwise. These flashes are evident in the video at 1:30 and again at 2:24.

At 3:20 into the video, the tenant approaches the door, continuing the pretense of a phone conversation, likely with the intent of recording video footage. We believe this was done to scrutinize the area for cameras with greater detail at a later time. Shortly thereafter, he is seen striking the exterior light fixture, an act clearly visible in the video at 3:42.

This incident appears to be another instance of erratic behavior, which we have observed to correlate with periods when the tenant lacks narcotics. Such behavior includes restlessness and involuntary movements, symptomatic of withdrawal from potent drugs.

While we cannot definitively identify the substance involved, there is a strong likelihood that it is cocaine, based on repeated observations of the tenant engaging in transactions involving white powders at his doorstep. This has been corroborated by several neighbors and is further evidenced by frequent visits to vehicles and motorcycles, as well as audible indications of drug use, including chopping sounds, snorting, and exclamations, occurring sporadically throughout the day and night.

Video: (New camera setup, a21 phone camera in door peep hole)
     ⓘ This video utilizes media codecs that are incompatible with Firefox and requires a browser based on Chrome to play.

ⓘ The video lacks audio as it is streamed via YouTube directly to a private profile. This approach not only leverages YouTube’s unlimited storage capacity but also ensures access to the footage in the event the recording device is compromised. Nonetheless, due to YouTube’s copyright policies, the audio was removed after detecting copyrighted content from a television program in the background.
Click here to enlarge.

Photos: (small selection of screenshots taken from video)

item.title: Henchmen at door | 12th May 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: on the 12th May 2024, at 9:51PM, an individual known to associate with the resident of unit number 14...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
on the 12th May 2024, at 9:51PM, an individual known to associate with the resident of unit number 14 was observed attempting to gain unauthorized access to our residence. This person repeatedly returned to our property, engaging in suspicious behavior that suggested an intent to vandalize or forcibly enter. Accompanying this individual was another person, whom we have strong reasons to believe is the tenant of number 14. This belief is substantiated by prior observations of their association, auditory evidence of movement on the staircase correlating with their presence, and their recurrent proximity to the front area of number 14.
The situation necessitated my intervention to vocally confront the individual in question to prevent further escalation, considering the severe health risk posed to an individual with pre-existing heart conditions, and the potential for property damage.

Reported To:
We told the police by phone whilst inquire about a callback that was due over two months ago. However, it seems improbable that the report was logged, as we have yet to receive any follow-up communication from them.

Impact:
Very stressful and not good for Lucy’s heart conditions and now she can’t sleep until the sun comes up every night from stress of everything.

Key Points:
Very stressed, not good for Lucy’s heart condition, Associated with the tenant of number 14.

Details:
At precisely 9:51 PM, an individual previously observed in communication with the occupant of flat number 14 was witnessed manipulating the door handle of our flat. Initially, the individual approached the door directly and appeared to attempt entry using the side of their hand, presumably to avoid leaving fingerprints. Upon realizing the door was secured, the individual departed, initially veering right, then returning left in the direction of residence number 14.

Shortly thereafter, it became evident that the individual was not alone, as another person appeared alongside them in the video footage. It is our assertion that the primary subject is the tenant of number 14, who has both the motive and the history to justify suspicion of tampering with our property. This individual’s known involvement in drug-related activities lends credence to the likelihood of a quid pro quo arrangement, wherein the accomplice was compensated with narcotics for meddling with our door.

In light of the distressing situation, particularly due to the potential health risks posed to Lucy, an individual with pre-existing heart conditions, I felt compelled to address the individual at the door. My intent was to inquire about their actions and to insist on their departure to alleviate the stress on the aforementioned individual. The responses received were slurred and punctuated with giggles, indicative of intoxication, presumably resulting from substances obtained from the tenant of number 14.

Following this confrontation, we heard sounds consistent with someone ascending the staircase. Although the noise was quieter than usual, the timing aligned with the observed activities.”

Conversation: Me shouting to the guy outside before Lucy had a stress heart attack (Video + Audio below)

Me: The F**k you doing?
Guy Outside: inaudible
Me (to Lucy) what did he say?
Lucy (to me) I Don’t know, i can’t tell..
Me: what are you doing out there
Guy Outside: I’m Waiting
Me: For what?
Guy Outside:*Inaudible mumbling*
Me: Waiting for what
Guy outside: More inaudible mumbling
Me: What?
Guy Outside: I’m waiting for my mate
Me: Well why are you waiting outside our door?
Guy Outside: *Inaudible mumbling”
Me: We’ve seen you try the handle
Guy outside: I Didn’t try the door handle, what you talking about?
Me: We just saw you try the F****ng door handle
Guy Outside: I didn’t try the door handle, I’m waiting for my mate
Me: Well, stop pissing about outside the house and go wait somewhere else
Guy outside: Alright (walks towards number 14, then goes upstairs)

Video: (New camera setup, a21 phone camera in door peep hole + clear door view)

item.title: Bird feeder trashed, sticking finger up at camera, spitting on door & windows | 26th April 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On the 26th of April, 2024, our sleep was disrupted by significant noise. Upon consulting our security camera, we...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On the 26th of April, 2024, our sleep was disrupted by significant noise. Upon consulting our security camera, we observed the resident of unit number 14 engaging in the forceful dismantlement of our bird feeder affixed to the wall. A review of the recorded footage revealed that at 1:50 AM, this individual directed an offensive gesture towards our room camera. At 2:32 AM, he was documented returning to the front of the property, where he loitered and exhibited restless behavior.
At 5:30 AM, the individual emerged with his dog, seemingly conducting a visual inspection of the surroundings. After escorting the dog back inside, he returned alone and proceeded to vandalize our bird feeder. Subsequently, at 5:50 AM, he was captured by the living room window repeating the offensive gesture and uttering a phrase that could be interpreted as a derogatory remark, before retreating to his residence.

Reported To:
WDH and the police

Impact:
Caused a lot of stress that negatively affects Lucy’s heart condition’s.

Key Points:
Stressed, Annoying, logged as “criminal damage”,

Details:
At approximately 5:30 AM, we were abruptly awakened by a series of loud bangs and heavy footsteps. Upon awakening, we observed through our door camera’s live feed that the individual residing at flat number 14 was forcibly removing our bird feeder from the exterior wall. It appeared that the feeder was detached, possibly by severing the steel core cable ties securing it. Subsequently, the individual was seen off-camera compressing the feeder and discarding it into our brown waste container.

In response to this disturbance, we reviewed the recorded footage from the entire night and early morning. The recordings revealed that at 1:50 AM, the same individual was present at our living room window, making an obscene gesture directed towards it. Later, at 2:32 AM, the individual was again captured by the camera returning to the front of our residence and began to walk back and forth near our front door.

The initial commotion that roused us at approximately 5:20 AM included more banging and stomping, audible even through silicone earplugs. The footage shows the individual exiting his residence with a dog, surveying the area as though to ensure no one was present. He then returned the dog indoors and re-emerged alone, continuing to pace near our front door while frequently glancing towards it, as if anticipating someone’s appearance. This behavior persisted for roughly ten minutes, during which he expectorated on the door and proceeded to rearrange our outdoor chairs before ultimately damaging and removing the bird feeder, as previously described.

It is noteworthy that the bird feeder had been installed for approximately one year, serving as a replacement for a prior feeder that had been similarly vandalized.

At 5:50 AM, the individual was once again observed making an obscene gesture towards the camera and appeared to verbalize an insult, which could be interpreted as “f**k off you stupid bastards,” before retreating to his flat.

Video: (New camera setup, a21 phone camera in door peep hole + clear door view)
————(other camera: basic Microsoft webcam in living room window)

item.title: Drain pipe pulled down | 1st April 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On the 1st of April, 2024, an abrupt and considerable disturbance in the form of a loud noise abruptly...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On the 1st of April, 2024, an abrupt and considerable disturbance in the form of a loud noise abruptly interrupted our sleep. This was immediately followed by the sound of someone hastening up the staircase. A review of our CCTV system footage indicated that the individual residing in flat number 14 had passed by our door. Within a brief interval of approximately one minute, the loud noise was once again detected, after which the same individual was observed returning at a quickened pace and ascending the stairs.
Upon the morning of the next day, the cause of the disturbance became apparent: a damaged drainpipe was discovered in a state of disarray upon the ground, evidently the source of the noise from the previous night.

Reported To:
WDH | Police

Impact:
Annoying he keeps trashing things and WDH haven’t just evicted him by now. (and later employed him a few months later despite all this!)
Logged with council (who are going to repair it who have now repaired it ) Also logged with police.

Key Points:
Stressed, Had to get WDH to Repair,

Details:
We were abruptly awakened by a substantial noise, which was discernible even through the use of silicone earplugs. This was swiftly succeeded by the sound of an individual ascending the staircase. Upon reviewing our door’s CCTV footage, it was observed that the resident of flat number 14 had traversed past our foor. Approximately one minute subsequent to their passage, the aforementioned noise was audible, followed by the individual’s hastened return and subsequent ascent of the stairs.

An inspection of the windows yielded no discernible cause for the disturbance, prompting our return to repose. However, the following morning, en route to our shopping endeavors, we encountered the source of the previous night’s disruption: a drainpipe, now in a state of disrepair, lay upon the ground with its fixtures severely damaged and scattered.

We have documented the condition of the drainpipe through photographs and have appended these to our incident report. Additionally, we have provided a recording from our door’s CCTV system, which captures the individual’s movements both prior to and following the incident.

Video: (New camera setup, a21 phone camera in door peep hole + clear door view)

Photos: Click to enlarge.

item.title: Looking in the letter box with phone | 9th March 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: on the 9th Match 2024, we were woke up by the letterbox flapping and noticed the tenant from number...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
on the 9th Match 2024, we were woke up by the letterbox flapping and noticed the tenant from number 14 looking in the letter box with his phone on two occasions. Once at 4:14am and then again at 6:10am second time with the flash on and camera app can be seen open on his phone. We did get this on CCTV which was sent to the police.

Reported To:
WDH and the police

Impact:
Made us worried he will try doing something again, possible checking what camera we have and where they are as he seemed to be recording and/or taking pictures with his phone, and he’ll be aware that the cameras can be viewed behind the front door from the time he previously put a brick through it.

Key Points:
Tired, Very Stressed, Lucy has stress chest pain, and can’t sleep

Details:
We were woken up in the early hours to some noise that turned out to be the letterbox flapping, looking on the cameras we saw that it was one again the tenant from number 14 messing about, he was using his phone to look through our letterbox.
The main reason he would likely want to do this is to see where out cameras are setup, because behind the door is a laptop screen showing 2 of them we have setup, and he would know that from the time he put a brick through the window and saw it.
The first time he did it is when we were originally woken up by it at exactly 4:14AM, he can be seen lurking around and then looking through the letterbox with the phone, likely recording / taking pictures.
The second time was at 6:10am which we saw live because we hadn’t been back to sleep after the first time expecting something else to happen (again).
We reported it to the police who have since dragged it out for months, not getting in touch with us when they were meant to, we even contacted them for an update and heard nothing back again (2½ months from this writing). the incident report is still marked as “open” on there website. because of this lack of effort by the police, WDH have been unable to move forward with there work.

Video: (New camera setup, a21 phone camera in door peep hole + clear door view)
 ~this setup was new and didn’t have a microphone at the time.

item.title: Front Door Window Smashed with Brick | 10th January 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: on the 10th January 2024, we were out for Lucy’s Birthday, when we came home our front door window...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
on the 10th January 2024, we were out for Lucy’s Birthday, when we came home our front door window had been smashed with a brick by the tenant of number 14, Police were called and sent CCTV that we had as you could hear the neighbour talking to someone outside. (the officer we spoke with that listened to the recording believe they are making up a fake story, portending someone else did it)

Reported To:
WDH and the police

Impact:
Caused Extreme stress, ruined Lucy’s birthday and gave her bad chest pain, almost killing her again with stress because of her heart conditions, and we had to pay £67 to have this fixed and boarded up due to the hole in the glass, our cat got glass in her eye which caused her both pain and stress.

Key Points:
Extreme Stress, Lucy has stress chest pain, glass everywhere, cat’s eye injured, we had to pay instead of the person who smashed it.

Details:
We went out for Lucy’s Birthday for dinner, and came back to hour flat’s front door window smashed with a brick, It was instantly obvious who would have done it because we have literally no enemy’s at all, we get along with everyone, including our other neighbour, but the tenant from, 14 has been nothing but a cancer on the whole street for everyone, from what the other neighbour have told us, he’s caused lodes of problems for them too, from being a drunk nuisance to assaulting another neighbour with a metal baseball bat for no reason, then making up a lie and getting away with it.
We went inside and checked the Letter Box cam we had setup at the time and found that it was done by 2 people, The tenant of number 14 (which was obvious) and one of his henchmen (people that hang out with him for drugs).
They made up a fake conversation claiming that someone in a balaclava had done it and run away, but even the police officer who listened to it didn’t believe that and advised us he’s more than likely making it up to cover his actions.
Because the camera we used at the time couldn’t see anything more than the ground nothing was done, not even any questioning, he just got away with it again.

Video: (old LetterBox cam pointing at ground but has audio)

item.title: Eggs thrown at house | 18th December 2023
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: on the 18th December 2023, we were woken up to the sound of shouting and eggs being thrown at...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
on the 18th December 2023, we were woken up to the sound of shouting and eggs being thrown at our house aswell as banging on the door.

Reported To:
We reported the incident to WDH who opened a new case up with Joe.
We previously had Richard who didn’t do much to help us, he wanted to close our case often and failed to put us on the out of hours list at the time he said he would, because of that we missed 3 opportunity to use it, since we did get added though, the noise is too spread out to predict when to have it observed. He had also told us he would change the case from a noise complaint to an harassment and assault case after i was attacked on the 25th September 2023 but didn’t do that, and then closed our case a week later.
Joe however has been a lot more helpful so far.

Impact:
Caused more worrying as every time I hear a noise anymore, I panic fearing it is the neighbour doing something else, this has gotten worse after this happened. It is also another reason we do not go out much anymore.

Key Points:
Our door was trashed again by him (again), We were woken up probably for the 10000th time since moving in, animals were scared, Not good for Lucy’s heart conditions (that we made him aware of back when we moved in), Everything covered in egg (again) and when cleaned off he re-eggs it every time

Details:
We were woken up around every half an hour by what sounded like hammering on the floor from around 10pm.
We were then woken by shouting and banging on our front door, We checked our cameras to find that our front door, spare bedroom, bathroom and kitchen had all been egged.
We checked our letter box camera (old camera setup) and could see his feet and hear his voice while pounding on our door yelling ‘shut the fuck up’(we had been in bed since 9pm).
is then seen walking back and then the door been pelted with eggs.
The door handle had also broken (again), we assume he had tried to get in again as he has done this a few times before. The handle was stuck up and no longer retracted correctly.
shortly before this we caw him knock briefly, walk away and wait, then throw eggs at small bedroom window, it can be heard on the Door Cam but can’t been seen on our old setup. Due to the time gap it’s easy to assume he planned on throwing those eggs in the house and/or at us when the door was opened

Video: (Can’t find the video without text overlay, this one has text descriptions)

item.title: Attacked whilst having a cig outside | 25th September 2023
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On the 25th September 2023, I was attacked whilst doing nothing more than attempting to have a cig outside...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On the 25th September 2023, I was attacked whilst doing nothing more than attempting to have a cig outside the flat.
Unfortunately at this time we didn’t have a camera set up that could see outside because something like this was unexpected as we get on with every single other neighbour in the area and have had zero enemy’s up-to this point, the attached footage is us coming in afterwards and him attempting to brake in before the police turned up.

Assault Summery:
Tenant of 14 Pine Close attacked me (tenant of 15 pine close) for no reason, instantly fought dirty and made no attempt to stop even when it was clear i was only trying to get away and not fight back because i believed back then there was still chance for peace.

Reason for assault:
We think he had run out of cocaine, and was acting childish because we had recently reported him for making too much noise (which we attempted to speak with him about like polite adults, as have WDH and the environmental health agency to no avail because he simply ignores everyone.)

Reported To:
We reported the incident to WDH and the police.
the police arrested him but he was simply able to lie, saying that I started it, and got out the next day, then as soon as he came back, he smashed our house wall up at side of the door.
WDH Logged it but at the time we were dealing with a guy named Richard who was not interested in helping us at all and just wanted to close our issue all the time, as well as that he failed to put us on the out of hours list when he said he would, of which we attempted to use 3 times that week and missed our best opportunity for it, since then he’s been able to realize we can report noise and separates him loud bangs randomly on purpose making it impossible to predict for someone from WDH to come witness.

Impact:
Michael had to be taken to a&e due to the swelling on his face and eye (he could not see properly for over 2 months out of the eye the neighbour put his thumb in). He had a serious concussion, facial bruising and eye injury. Caused a lot of stress and worry. Caused us to not leave the house a lot as well as no longer going to the door and smoking and instead smoking in the house due to worry this would happen again. Caused us to no longer go out in the dark as well as no longer having Michael’s brother & sister come down due to fear they might end up been involved or targeted by him. This was also same for my nana who lives a few doors up. We do worry anytime we see him, thinking he is going to try and do this again or worse. We also started sleeping in the living room rather than our bed room as it is the first room you get too when you enter the house, and as he has now tried to get inside more than once we are worried about him breaking in and feel safer sleeping well away.
Also worried about the structure of the door and if he could break in from doing this. Stressed that it had happened and nothing seemed to be getting done. Letters were sent but no response to them nor was there any contact from him to them or vice versa.

Key Points:
My eye was blurry for about 2 months can still hurt to this day when touched, He threaten to murder us both, He physically assaulted one of us and would have assaulted us both if we hadn’t got back in when we did, A&E said I had a serious concussion, He Lied to the police claiming that I started it, and got let out fast, then smashed our wall up (likely attempting one of many braking attempts).

Details:
Assaulted outside flat for no reason whilst having a cig, and moving the trash off our door step he put childishly threw there and spat all over. Tenant from 14 Pine Close came out shouting “What the F**k are you doing”, ran up to me (Tenant from 15 Pine Close) and started punching me, I pulled his jacket over his face in an attempt to throw him off so we could get back in the house but he threw me on the ground via his finger in my right eye socket, held my head down jamming his finger past my eyeball and punching me in he head with the other hand, because of the finger in the eye i felt like i was falling to sleep, if my partner who I’m supposed to care for due to her many disability’s hadn’t have pulled him off of me, he would 100% have blinded me and likely attempted to murder me.
We were able to get into the house fast and call the police, during that he was throwing his self at the door aswell as random items outside causing permanent damage to the door that WDH had to repair (again)
When the police eventually got here they immediately arrested him and took pictures of my face, then sent me to A&E, there i was rapidly checked over and sent back home with no medication and had to endure a swollen face and blurry vision and 16 paracetamol a day for about 2 months whilst he got nothing but a overnight stay in a cell, then as soon as he came home the next day, he immediately smashed up our wall next to the door, which WDH had to re-concrete.

Video: (Can’t find the video without text overlay, this one has text descriptions)

Photos: Click to enlarge.

item.title: Eggs thrown at house | 14th August 2023
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: on the 14th August 2023, we were tidying up in the Living Room and out of nowhere, for no...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
on the 14th August 2023, we were tidying up in the Living Room and out of nowhere, for no reason at all, the neighbour from upstairs came stomping down and threw an entire box of eggs all over our living room windows and ran off up the street.

Reported To:
WDH

Impact:
We became very stressed, rang Richard from WDH anti-social department who came to look at what had been done. Lucy was too stressed & worried and had to go over to her mum’s to calm down from the stress as it was causing bad chest pains, feeling dizzy and berating funny, yet another example of an instance he could have killed her with his childish behavior, and this is one of the lesser things he’s done.

Key Points:
Very Stressed, windows all egged (happened again and again after cleaning), Lucy almost passed out from stress and had to leave (could have been worse.)

Details:
Upstairs had already been stomping about shouting all day and we couldn’t concentrate on anything much.
We were both in the living room tidying up and suddenly for no reason at all, the tenant of number 14 came stomping down stairs with a full box of eggs and threw them all at our room window, then ran off down the street laughing like a child.

item.title: 1 Month noise log | 28th June 2023 – 24th July 2023
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: Between the 18th June 2023 and the 24th July 2023 we produced a set of log’s detailing everything we...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
Between the 18th June 2023 and the 24th July 2023 we produced a set of log’s detailing everything we could hear in detail for Richard of WDH.

Details:
For just short of a month we created details logs of everything we heard in that time, the information logged is arranged in an easy to understand way and scored between 1 and 10 on how bad the noise was, and what times.
We originally created these for Richard at WDH as he said written logs could help however he didn’t seem to be interested in them nor did he bring anything up regarding them.

Document : (Detailed logs given to Richard at WDH for the 28th June 2023 – 24th July 2023)

> Click Here to open the PDF in new tab.
